content:
After pulling latest changes I can no longer build rustc and am getting

Copying stage0 rustc from stage0 (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu -> x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu / x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu)
Assembling stage1 compiler (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu)
thread 'main' panicked at 'src.symlink_metadata() failed with No such file or directory (os error 2)', src/bootstrap/lib.rs:1324:24
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
Build completed unsuccessfully in 0:00:02

Have tried running x.py clean and re-cloning rustc but I still get this panic :grimacing: has anyone else had this problem? im totally lost as to what to do here
Using some unusual filesystem? FAT? NFS? WSL?
known bug -- this should be fixed by https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/91720
gonna give that PR a try :thinking:
Getting this same panic on Apple Silicon.
I would expect it on all platforms until 91720 lands, if you're on recent enough master.
Yep, I confirmed that that PR fixed it
